concept.title: Bypass Static Switch and Inverter Output Contactor

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Bypass Static Switch and Inverter Output Contactor

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Describes the function of the static bypass switch and inverter output contactor, including load transfer, inverter synchronization, and protection mechanisms.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: static bypass switch; inverter output contactor; bypass line; inverter module; bypass power path; transfer control circuit

othermeta.name: tags
othermeta.content: static switch, bypass mode, inverter transfer, synchronization, load transfer, protection

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: explain how the ups manages load transfer between inverter and bypass using the static switch and output contactor

conbody.p: The static switch can automatically without interruption switch between supplying the load from the inverter output or the bypass mains. This can occur if the inverter output voltage or frequency is outside of the defined tolerances, for example, if there is a short circuit or the inverter is overloaded.

The status of the inverter output contactor is controlled by the bypass static switch controller control, so that the activation of the bypass static switch is always done together with the opening of the inverter output contactor.
When the inverter output is back within the tolerance, the static switch will automatically switch back to inverter operation (normal operation).
It is also possible to manually switch to either inverter output (force inverter operation) or bypass static switch output (force bypass operation).
